reviews.text: I stayed at this hostel when I was on a college study abroad trip. There were 12 of us and we got 2 rooms, one was downstairs and the other was upstairs. The one downstairs had bunk beds, a sink and a locker in the room. It was right by the lobby so it got a bit noisy at night because of the bar.
reviews.title: Rooms were great but....

likes.disliked: — Safety issues, noise, cleanliness of some bathrooms

reviews.title: Whole Floor to Ourselves!
reviews.text: The room upstairs was very cozy and seemed more "home-y". It had a cute little door and a small window. The beds were all twins and there were no bunkbeds. The room had just lockers, no sink. However, the bathroom was much more private upstairs because fewer people stay upstairs it seems. The room was pleasant, however, again, the bar music was a bit loud into the wee hours of the morning.

reviews.title: Cosy, clean and friendly
reviews.text: The bathroom upstairs was very clean. There was plenty of toilet paper, the toilets were clean and the 2 showers were spotless. The downstairs bathrooms were overcrowded and rather dirty. There was no toilet paper and dirt in the shower.

The room downstairs was broken into in the middle of the night (3:30am). A drunk person walking along the street just climbed right into the window and stumbled around the room. This scared our group causing us to loose a lot of sleep that night! We just didn't feel entirely safe the rest of the trip there.
reviews.title: We loved it!

reviews.text: The breakfast in the morning was pretty good. There were a few things to chooes from including: rolls & jelly, ham and eggs, and bacon. I would only stay there again if I were upstairs where the windows are too small to climb in and it's tougher to reach.
reviews.title: Smokey and loud and rude
